wikipedia_page.main: Marian Muriel Whiting (1881 – 1978) was a British horticulturalist and plant collector, notable for collecting plants from Hong Kong and Guangzhou. She was born in London and spent a portion of her childhood in Hong Kong before studying at London University. Over 600 of her specimens were donated to the Kew Botanical Gardens.  In 1940, she became a Fellow of the Linnean Society of London, and volunteered at Kew for many years.  The standard author abbreviation Whiting is used to indicate this person as the author when citing a botanical name.

response: *Marian Muriel Whiting (1881–1978), British horticulturalist and plant collector
